name: unbarricaded
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something is unbarricaded, it does not have a fence or a line or pile of objects across, around, or in front of it, so people can go where they want to go. : A local resident who witnessed the accident said that several parts of the dangerous route had been left unbarricaded. As the car drove onto the unbarricaded bridge, it was swept away by the strong current caused by heavy rain. Related word
barricade
More examplesFewer examplesWe had to drive round a large unbarricaded hole in the road.In one incident, two children fell into an open unbarricaded pit and died.The driver had attempted to cross the unbarricaded concrete bridge after seeing several SUVs cross before him without incident.
